description.about aidoc:
Aidoc is a pioneering force in clinical AI. Our clinical AI imaging solutions help physicians quickly identify and diagnose urgent cases and improve patient outcomes. Built on Aidoc’s exclusive aiOS, we analyze and aggregate medical data to enable care teams to operationalize the unexpected and work seamlessly with a continued focus on the patient. Aidoc AI is always on, running in the background to change the foreground.
Our solutions are used in more than 1,000 hospitals, including leading health systems in the US. Funded by some of the industry’s leading VC’s, Aidoc has raised more than $250 million to date, and was chosen as one of TIME’s 50 most genius companies.
description.about this role:
The Senior AI Solutions Engineer plays a critical, high-impact role in scaling our clinical AI solutions and ensuring the ability to deploy high quality products, monitor and support them in production. This position requires strong software and data engineering skills to elevate our operational systems. 
You will be responsible for independently driving complex E2E projects, demonstrating flexible thinking and making cost-effective decisions while balancing quality versus speed. 
As a senior member of the team, one of the core functions is mentoring team members to improve their software engineering skills and serve as a vital technical bridge, forming strong collaborations with both the R&D and Product organizations. 
Success in this dynamic and fast-driven environment demands a focused "getting things done" and "can-do" attitude to deliver value with speed and quality.
description.responsibilities:
Automate and streamline AI operations
 - develop tools to automate AI deployment, data validation, and reporting for smooth production integration of AI solutions built by our research teams.
Act as the production technical expert
 - collaborate with Product and R&D teams during feature design to ensure production feasibility, scalability, and operational excellence.
Lead end-to-end tool development
 - gather requirements, design, implement, and deploy operational tools and pipelines in collaboration with cross-functional teams.
Drive engineering quality and play a key role in team member mentoring
 - uphold and develop engineering standards while fostering innovation.
Investigate and resolve complex data challenges
 - analyze and address production data issues, including data quality, availability, performance anomalies, and integration challenges.
Collaborate with customer-facing teams
 - understand real-world operational challenges, develop scalable solutions, and bridge the gap between customer needs and AI system behavior.
Ensure ongoing AI model reliability
 - design and implement mechanisms for monitoring data and performance degradation, and maintaining long-term model effectiveness.
Develop monitoring and analytics frameworks
 - create metrics and dashboards to track production health, data integrity, and AI performance across the deployment lifecycle.
description.requirements:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, and other related STEM fields). A Master's degree is an advantage.
At least 4 years of proven experience in software or data engineering in a professional setting. 
Familiarity with statistical analysis, machine learning concepts, AI model evaluation and system engineering concepts.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues.
Strong collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Flexible and adaptive mindset - we need to deliver solutions with both quality and speed in mind, making decisions based on the dynamic tradeoffs between them along the way.
Experience in working in technically oriented operation environments is an advantage.
Tech stack:
Strong proficiency in Python.
Deep understanding of data pipelines - working with ETLs, CI/CD processes, task management tools such as airflow, cloud environments and varied data platforms such as databricks, athena and postgres.
Experience in using the latest AI developer tools in software engineering, such as cursor / co-pilot, is a must.

r to take part in leading Aidoc’s data vision using a lake-house architecture, and building high-scale solutions for handling and consuming the different data assets of the company.

Design and build ETL pipelines that handle diverse clinical data for research. Write production SQL and craft schemas that evolve gracefully as researchquestions change.

Automate releases with CI/CD and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform or AWS CDK).

Familiarity with modern lakehouse / warehouse tech, like Databricks, Delta Lake, Iceberg, Snowflake, Redshift.
Proficiency in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools, like Terraform or AWS CDK.
Strong understanding of distributed systems, microservices architecture, containerization, and CI/CD pipelines.
Ability to take full product ownership from ideation to delivery, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Familiarity with agile development methodologies.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to work effectively across teams and a customer-oriented mindset. Clear English communication is required.

Deep expertise in Databricks (Delta Lake, Unity Catalog, DLT).
Experience modelling EHR or imaging data and understanding standards like HL7 or FHIR.
Prior work in regulated domains (healthcare, fintech, aviation).
BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

description.description: Aidoc is recruiting a Senior Manager of Product Marketing in the United States. Join our team!
description.about aidoc:
Aidoc helps health systems deliver smarter and faster care when it matters most. Its mission is to transform patient outcomes through ‘always on’ clinical AI, eliminating preventable care gaps that lead to loss of lives and disabilities. Through our proprietary aiOS™ platform, Aidoc seamlessly integrates real-time intelligence into provider workflows, helping physicians make faster clinical decisions for over 45 million patients a year. With the most FDA-cleared AI solutions in its category and deployments across 150+ health systems globally, Aidoc elevates the physician and patient experience.
Backed by General Catalyst, Square Peg, NVentures (NVIDIA’s venture arm), and four major U.S. health systems, Aidoc has raised $370 million to date, including a recent $150 million round to accelerate development of CARE™, its clinical-grade foundation model.
description.about this role:
Aidoc’s 
Senior Manager of Product Marketing, Cardiovascular
 will support our strategic product marketing efforts in the Cardiovascular space, owning a portfolio of AI solutions spanning from disease awareness to care coordination to patient management.
As part of the product marketing organization, you will develop Aidoc’s cardiovascular go-to-market (GTM) strategy, product positioning, lead voice-of-customer initiatives, and curate market insights that directly influence product development, sales enablement, revenue growth, and are responsible for the product line’s commercial success. 
This role requires an externally-focused mindset, ability to be both strategic and hands-on, with a strong understanding of the cardiovascular service line and competitive landscape spanning medical device and imaging AI companies.
description.responsibilities:
Go To Market 
Own the end-to-end GTM strategy for Aidoc’s Cardiovascular AI portfolio across new and existing markets, including pipeline and ARR attachment and adjacent market seeding pathways such as clinical trials and research initiatives.
Partner with Product, Sales, Customer/Solution Success, Product and Revenue Enablement, Clinical Research and Marketing teams to align business objectives with marketing initiatives.
Bring strategic input into Aidoc’s portfolio roadmap, representing market needs and customer insights through voice of customer and market research.
Positioning, Messaging & Narrative Development
Define strategic positioning, differentiated messaging, and value propositions tailored to clinical decision-makers and end users (Service Line Chairs, cardiovascular care teams, vascular surgeons, etc.).
Translate technical and clinical complexity into compelling, outcome-driven narratives that resonate across the healthcare enterprise.
Partner with VP Product Marketing to contribute to regular external-facing roadmaps that demonstrate continuous value for Aidoc customers of cardiovascular solutions.
Market Intelligence & Customer Insights
Oversee market research and competitive analysis to identify trends, whitespace opportunities, and strategic risks in Cardiovascular space.
Drive voice-of-customer programs in partnership with Customer Success and Product teams to inform positioning, messaging, and product strategy.
Partner with VP, Product Marketing to inform Aidoc’s formal competitive intelligence and win/loss programs.
Thought Leadership & Brand Elevation
Generate thought leadership content that establishes Aidoc as a category leader in AI-powered cardiovascular care delivery.
Leverage  relationships with cardiovascular KOLs and industry influencers to amplify Aidoc’s market presence, in collaboration with Aidoc KOL leadership.
Sales & Enablement Strategy
Oversee the development of high-impact enablement assets including pitch decks, buyer journey maps, ROI tools, battlecards, and sales playbooks.
In collaboration with Enablement and RevOps, own go-to-market readiness across sales and customer-facing teams.
Performance & Optimization
Define key performance indicators for product marketing success and lead ongoing measurement and optimization efforts.
Ensure product launches and marketing initiatives are evaluated for ROI and continuously improved.
description.requirements:
5-7 years of product marketing experience in cardiology-focused healthcare technology, medical device, medical imaging, AI/ML, or clinical software.
Experience in launching B2B healthcare solutions, particularly those that intersect with cardiology or imaging-based specialties.
Knowledge of clinical workflows in cardiology, regulatory considerations, and AI-based clinical decision support.
Experience building cross-functional marketing strategies that drive growth and market share.
Proven experience managing KOL engagement and thought leadership initiatives is a plus.
Strategic thinker with a bias for action—able to operate independently and prioritize in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
description.working at aidoc:
We’re a dynamic, collaborative and fast growing team of more than 400 global employees, committed to improving the world of healthcare. We’re looking for mission-driven people excited to do transformative work.
We have offices in Tel Aviv and New York City, but Aidoc is a remote-first workplace. We’re able to hire US-based employees across the continental United States, although certain roles may be region-specific.
What we offer:
A range of medical, dental and vision benefits
Stock options for all full-time employees
20 days of paid vacation, plus sick days and holidays
A 401(k) plan, life insurance, plus long and short term disability
The opportunity to directly improve medical care and impact patient outcomes
Aidoc is deeply committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace, and to the principle of equal opportunity for all individuals. We prohibit harassment of any type as well as discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

description.description: Aidoc is recruiting a Senior Full-Stack Engineer for the AI department in Tel Aviv. Join our team!
description.about aidoc:
Aidoc is a pioneering force in clinical AI. Our clinical AI imaging solutions help physicians quickly identify and diagnose urgent cases and improve patient outcomes. We analyze and aggregate medical data to enable care teams to work seamlessly with a continued focus on the patient. 
Our solutions are used in more than 1000 hospitals, including leading health systems in the US. Funded by some of the industry’s leading VC’s, Aidoc has raised more than $250 million to date, and was chosen as one of TIME’s 50 most genius companies.
description.about this role: The Senior Software Engineer’s main responsibilities include developing customer-facing products, enhancing medical workflows, integrating with our AI solutions, and scaling our product’s technical aspects, as well as expanding our product offerings.
description.responsibilities:
Work as an integral part of our senior (and exceptional) development team.
You will have a leading role, a central responsibility, and will be the owner for the design and development of many of our components and projects.
Receive end-to-end ownership for product features from ideation to post-deployment, and work closely with our Product and UX teams to bring the team’s vision and mission to life.
Be trusted with autonomy, freedom, and influence to design solutions and make complex technical decisions, in a critical position for the company’s growth.
description.requirements:
At least 7 years of hands-on experience in building complex systems
Deep understanding of software engineering fundamentals – object-oriented design, code optimization, and complexity, while maintaining elegant and effective technological solutions, and a love for clean code.
Hands-on experience in building high-performance cloud production services end-to-end, including architecture design, research, development, testing, deployment, and monitoring.
Cloud infra – AWS stack or equivalent, serverless eco system (especially Lambda) - advantage
PostgreSQL or equivalent - advantage
Experience in high-scale projects (a lot of data, a lot of requests, a lot of events) with end-to-end ownership.
Containers and Orchestration – Docker, K8s, Terraform - advantage
A “can-do” attitude and a strong sense of ownership
Independent learning capability and curiosity without boundaries
Strong ability to lead end-to-end development processes
Passion for building generic and robust software architecture 
BSc/MSc in Computer Science, or equivalent - advantage
Alumni of an IDF technology unit - advantage

description.description: Aidoc is recruiting a Solution Engineer for the Delivery department in Tel Aviv. Join our team!
description.about aidoc:
Aidoc is a pioneering force in clinical AI. Our clinical AI imaging solutions help physicians quickly identify and diagnose urgent cases and improve patient outcomes. We analyze and aggregate medical data to enable care teams to work seamlessly with a continued focus on the patient. 
Our solutions are used in more than 1000 hospitals, including leading health systems in the US. Funded by some of the industry’s leading VC’s, Aidoc has raised more than $250 million to date, and was chosen as one of TIME’s 50 most genius companies.
description.about this role:
The solution engineer will be responsible for creating and enhancing tools that assist our T1 and T2 support teams and Implementation Managers, while also providing expert-level T3 support for complex system-related issues.
The team plays a crucial role in developing and optimizing the delivery platforms’ reliability, performance, and scalability while ensuring that any system issues are diagnosed and resolved quickly to minimize downtime.
description.responsibilities:
Design and develop automation tools to support the scale efforts of the deployment of our solution to our customers.
Work with customers to plan and design the Aidoc solution within the customer’s environment according to their specific needs and constraints.
Design, build, and maintain tools that streamline workflows for T1/T2 support teams and Implementation Managers, allowing them to efficiently troubleshoot, manage incidents, and deploy solutions.
Own the infrastructure of the tools in use, ensuring scalability, reliability, and efficiency. Optimize performance, manage updates, and support evolving operational needs.
Automate processes to minimize manual interventions for support teams, improving operational efficiency and speeding up response times for common incidents.
Provide expert-level T3 support for system-related issues, working cross-functionally with development and operations teams to diagnose, debug, and resolve complex platform problems in production.
Monitor system performance, proactively identifying potential issues and bottlenecks. Ensure that monitoring tools and alerts are properly configured for early issue detection.
Work closely with developers and engineers to understand system functionality and architecture, ensuring that support teams have the right tools and knowledge to address and resolve incidents.
Create clear, user-friendly documentation for support teams and internal stakeholders, including knowledge base articles, runbooks, and troubleshooting guides. Ensure these resources are updated regularly.
Lead architecture requirements with customers and address to DevOps and Engineering group.
description.requirements:
Previous experience in one or more of the following roles:
Solution Engineer 
Professional Services Engineer
Automations Engineer
Demonstrated knowledge of SQL.
Demonstrated knowledge of Windows Server.
Good understanding of the IT field: servers, networking and secured architectures.
Hands-on experience with VMware vSphere (ESXi and vCenter), including knowledge of clustering features such as High Availability (HA), vMotion, and DRS.
Knowledge & experience working with production systems, in cloud environments and on-premises.
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or Powershell, with experience in creating automation scripts that simplify platform management and troubleshooting tasks.
Ability to dive into the depths of many technological domains and have the ability to be highly detail-oriented and thorough while maintaining and providing a comprehensive perspective of the bigger picture.
Fluent written and spoken English.
DevOps experience (Writing scripts, Docker, CI/CD pipelines)
Former position in the healthcare industry, and healthcare IT systems and services - 
advantage
.
Experience with DICOM, HL7, and FHIR protocols, as well as PACS, RIS, EHR systems - 
advantage
.

description.description: Aidoc is recruiting a Staff Software Engineer in Tel Aviv. Join our team!
description.about aidoc:
Aidoc is the market leader in the field of AI for medical imaging.
Our products help doctors detect life-threatening medical conditions in medical images, based on cutting-edge deep-learning algorithms.
As an aidocee, you’ll have the chance to experience real mission-critical, medical architecture and take part in the ongoing efforts to enhance our scale, resilience and time to market. Our culture is fast-paced, empowering, and collaborative. We work together as a team, and enable each team member to have a significant impact on our product. Each team member has a high-level of independence and makes important decisions that influence our customers.
We believe our people are by far our most important asset. We see it as the most important aspect of our job to make sure our team members feel we truly care for them as humans, feel highly appreciated for their accomplishments and efforts and constantly develop their careers. You will work in a unique professional culture championing thorough software engineering and ownership.
description.about this role:
We’re looking for a 
Staff Engineer
 to lead the design and development of central components within Aidoc’s Imaging Platform.
You’ll combine hands-on development with architectural leadership - solving complex engineering challenges, guiding your team through design decisions, and ensuring our systems are robust, scalable, and maintainable.
You’ll collaborate with other senior engineers, tech leads, and product partners to define technical direction, drive innovation, and improve engineering practices across the group.
This is a role for someone who thrives on building well-designed systems, driving technical excellence within the team and mentoring peers.
description.responsibilities:
Lead the design and implementation of scalable and reliable backend services.
Drive architectural discussions and make key technical decisions within your domain.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business and product goals into technical solutions.
Deliver high-quality, maintainable, and testable code while ensuring best practices for security, performance, and reliability.
Mentor and support engineers through design reviews, code reviews, and knowledge sharing.
Continuously improve development processes, observability, and deployment pipelines.
Contribute to the evolution of the platform’s architecture as the company and product scale.
description.requirements:
10+ years of hands-on experience designing and developing complex, production-grade systems.
Proven track record in architecting and leading large-scale software projects.
Deep understanding of system design, distributed systems, and software architecture patterns.
Strong coding skills in one or more modern backend languages (e.g., Python, Go, Node.js, Java, C#).
Experience with cloud environments (AWS or equivalent), containerized deployments, and infrastructure as code (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform).
Experience designing and scaling event-driven architectures and data-intensive systems.
Excellent communication and influencing skills - able to align multiple teams toward a shared technical vision.
A proactive mindset, strong sense of ownership, and passion for solving complex engineering problems.
Advantage: Experience working in healthcare or familiarity with medical data standards (DICOM, HL7, FHIR), Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems.

description.description: Aidoc is recruiting a Strategic Growth Director in the United States. Join our team!
description.about aidoc:
Aidoc helps health systems deliver smarter and faster care when it matters most. Its mission is to transform patient outcomes through ‘always on’ clinical AI, eliminating preventable care gaps that lead to loss of lives and disabilities. Through our proprietary aiOS™ platform, Aidoc seamlessly integrates real-time intelligence into provider workflows, helping physicians make faster clinical decisions for over 45 million patients a year. With the most FDA-cleared AI solutions in its category and deployments across 150+ health systems globally, Aidoc elevates the physician and patient experience.
Backed by General Catalyst, Square Peg, NVentures (NVIDIA’s venture arm), and four major U.S. health systems, Aidoc has raised $370 million to date, including a recent $150 million round to accelerate development of CARE™, its clinical-grade foundation model.
description.about this role:
Hospitals and health systems face an urgent challenge: rising patient demand, physician shortages, and growing workloads have created critical backlogs, sometimes extending for weeks. To address this, healthcare leaders are seeking transformative solutions to optimize care delivery.
Clinical AI is quickly gaining traction as a key enabler for change. Health system executives are increasingly confident in its potential to improve diagnostic accuracy, enhance patient outcomes, and reduce strain on healthcare teams. In response, health systems are prioritizing AI deployment with strategic governance to scale enterprise-wide solutions—solutions that deliver far greater clinical benefits than isolated tools.
As a 
Strategic Growth Director
 at Aidoc, you will play a pivotal role in driving the adoption of our enterprise platform (aiOS) and clinical AI solutions within large health systems. You will leverage your expertise to build and nurture relationships with C-suite executives and clinical leaders, guiding them toward a deeper understanding of the multi-dimensional value of clinical AI. Through strategic advisory and partnership, you’ll help health systems overcome challenges like physician shortages and workflow inefficiencies, ultimately improving care quality, financial sustainability, and competitive advantage. Your efforts will lead to long-term, multi-year partnerships that accelerate care delivery, support better clinical decision-making, and save lives.
description.responsibilities:
Build & Maintain Strategic Relationships
: Establish and cultivate consultative relationships with C-suite executives and clinical leaders across large health systems. Develop a thorough understanding of their strategic priorities, challenges, and goals.
Articulate the Value of AI
: Become a trusted advisor, effectively communicating the value proposition of Aidoc’s platform. Ensure key stakeholders are aligned on the platform’s transformative power for both clinicians and patients.
Manage & Grow Accounts
: Oversee a portfolio of high-value accounts, focusing on penetrating new customers while nurturing and expanding existing relationships. Drive adoption across your account base to deliver measurable value.
Collaborate Cross-Functionally
: Partner with internal teams such as Marketing, Customer Success, and Innovation to align on seamless, strategic account plans that maximize success and impact.
Lead Forecasting & Pipeline Management
: Provide accurate forecasts and pipeline management, ensuring consistent progress towards and surpassing revenue targets.
description.requirements:
7+ years of experience
 in enterprise SaaS solution selling or IT transformation consulting, with a proven track record of driving the adoption of transformative cloud-based technologies.
Extensive experience
 working directly with C-suite executives to drive digital transformation within large health systems, navigating complex organizational dynamics.
Collaborative mindset
 with a history of working cross-functionally within organizations to solve challenges, align strategies, and ensure successful outcomes.
Proven ability to identify and capitalize on new enterprise business opportunities
 across both new and existing accounts, driving growth and expanding the customer base.
Consistent history of success
 in exceeding targets and delivering results in a high-stakes, target-driven environment.
Ability to travel
 as needed.

description.description: Aidoc is recruiting a Strategic product analyst in Tel Aviv. Join our team!
description.about aidoc:
Aidoc is a pioneering force in clinical AI. Our clinical AI imaging solutions help physicians quickly identify and diagnose urgent cases and improve patient outcomes. We analyze and aggregate medical data to enable care teams to work seamlessly with a continued focus on the patient. Aidoc’s AI is always on, running in the background to change the foreground.
Our solutions are used in more than 1000 hospitals, including leading health systems in the US. Funded by some of the industry’s leading VC’s, Aidoc has raised more than $250 million to date, and was chosen as one of TIME’s 50 most genius companies.
description.about this role:
We are seeking an experienced sharp and dynamic analytical mind to join our Product Analytics team as a Strategic product analyst. This position is ideally suited for those who are naturally passionate about learning, gaining knowledge, and analyzing anything they do and see with experience in utilizing data to make a significant impact. 
The role requires a combination of analytical, technical, problem-solving, communication, and project management skills, and it involves working closely with various stakeholders and customers - including Product Managers, Customer Success Managers, Operations teams, Data Engineers, UI/UX Designers, SW developers, and AI experts at all levels.
description.responsibilities:
As a Strategic product analyst at Aidoc’s Analytics group, you will play a critical role in expanding our data-driven vision by leading the analytical aspects of various products and services, focusing on:
Designing and reflecting products’ KPIs and performing trend analysis with key stakeholders
Conducting decision-support analysis for development and operations
Building customer-facing and value demonstration analytics products
Constantly improving our Analytics knowledge base and data platforms
The role is all about collaborating with stakeholders to craft their questions into tangible metrics and captivating visuals, empowering them to uncover insights and make informed decisions through the power of data. Plus, you get to dive deep into learning opportunities and document your discoveries, enriching our collective intelligence and fueling continuous improvement.
description.requirements:
4+ years of experience in the Analytics and Product domains, including roles such as Product Manager, Product Analyst, Data Analyst, or Data Scientist
Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as presentation skills
B.Sc or equivalent studies with extensive hands-on projects
A Master's degree - An advantage

The VP of Brand and Communications is responsible for setting the vision and building our brand awareness and comprehension from the ground up. Reporting directly to the CMO, this role sets the tone and strategy for our global brand, working closely with Product Marketing to drive positioning in the broader market, as well as developing strategy, messaging and momentum within our customer ecosystem.
This role develops key KPIs and scales a team of high-performing marketers across social media, earned media, marketing communications, content and creative. They set goals for the team, and ensure the team collaborates with cross-functional partners to gain further leverage.
This role develops and implements internal and external strategies for the organization to ensure unified, consistent, and positive messages that define and promote our corporate identity and mission. The role will also determine the communications strategy and execute programs that deliver communications objectives throughout Aidoc, ensuring that the public views the organization as the leader in enterprise clinical AI, with a focus on prospective buyers, customers, partners, investors and employees. You will also partner across Aidoc internally to support internal and external communication activities. This role manages all owned and earned channels of communication.
description.responsibilities:
Public Relations:
 Lead the company’s PR strategy, managing external communications and agency partnerships to drive visibility in top-tier media and ensure alignment with business goals.
Thought Leadership:
 Create and promote high-impact thought leadership content that reinforces category creation efforts and builds brand credibility with target audiences.
Brand & Category Marketing:
 Develop and execute strategic branding campaigns that evangelize Aidoc’s mission, reinforce market leadership, and support category definition and expansion.
Analyst & Influencer Relations:
 Build and maintain relationships with key analysts and industry influencers; collaborate with Product Marketing on the co-creation of joint marketing assets and thought leadership initiatives. 
Social Media & Community Engagement:
 Own brand awareness and audience engagement/growth strategy across social channels, particularly LinkedIn and Twitter, driving measurable growth and influence.
Content Strategy:
 Develop a rich, multi-format content strategy tailored for multiple stakeholders and optimized for search. Collaborate across departments to ensure consistency and SEO alignment.
Corporate Messaging:
 Lead the development and delivery of core company messages and ensure consistency across all communications, including packaging and positioning.
Events & Experiences:
 Oversee the strategy, planning, and execution of all external-facing events, including industry trade shows, partner events, and hosted executive experiences. Collaborate with the Product and Growth Marketing teams to ensure events drive pipeline, strengthen brand positioning, and are fully integrated into the broader marketing plan.
Internal Communications:
 Collaborate with executive leadership and department heads to craft internal communications that drive alignment, culture, and transparency across the organization.
Customer Marketing:
 Guide the creation of customer-centric content and ensure alignment with broader communications strategy to build loyalty, retention, and advocacy.
Online Community:
 Oversee the strategy for our digital customer community, ensuring meaningful, ongoing engagement with existing users and key stakeholders.
Website Strategy:
 Manage the website design and content and ensure the site is optimized for both organic and paid search in collaboration with the Growth Marketing team and our SEO agency.
Cross-Functional Collaboration:
 Partner closely with Product Marketing to craft a unified story across our solution portfolio. Partner with the Innovation Team to create educational content to elevate our expertise and establish Aidoc as a category leader.
Agency Management:
 Oversee key agency relationships including public relations, creative, and design partners to ensure output is high-quality, aligned, and brand-consistent.
Graphic design/creative

Strong strategic problem solver with the ability and the skills to see the bigger picture as well as understanding the details across clients and campaigns

title: Head of the ALMA Department of Engineering (Head of ADE)- International staff member

description.description:
* Important: this is an International job opportunity, applications will only be considered through the following channels (please do not apply through this portal):
Applicants submitting their application to ESO are invited to apply online at 
https://jobs.eso.org/
.
Applicants submitting their application to AUI/NRAO are invited to apply online at 
https://careers.nrao.edu
.
Applicants submitting their application to NAOJ are invited to send the application and all documents to 
https://forms.office.com/r/9DRfQjb35a
_________________________________________________________________________________________
The Atacama Large Millimeter/submillimeter Array (ALMA) is the world’s preeminent facility for millimeter and submillimeter-wave astronomy with transformational capabilities to study the origin and evolution of galaxies, stars and planets. ALMA consists of 66 antennas located on the Chajnantor plateau, 5000 meters altitude in northern Chile, and equipped with receivers covering atmospheric windows between 30 and 950 GHz.
ALMA is a partnership of the European Organisation for Astronomical Research in the Southern Hemisphere (ESO), the U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) and the National Institutes of Natural Sciences (NINS) of Japan in cooperation with the Republic of Chile. ALMA is funded by ESO on behalf of its Member States, by NSF in cooperation with the National Research Council of Canada (NRC) and the National Science Council of Taiwan (NSC) and by NINS in cooperation with the Academia Sinica (AS) in Taiwan and the Korea Astronomy and Space Science Institute (KASI).
ALMA continued development and operations are led by ESO on behalf of its Member States; by the National Radio Astronomy Observatory (NRAO), managed by Associated Universities, Inc. (AUI), on behalf of North America; and by the National Astronomical Observatory of Japan (NAOJ) on behalf of East Asia.
 
The Joint ALMA Observatory (JAO) provides the unified leadership and management of the continued development, commissioning and operation of ALMA.
The Joint ALMA Observatory invites applications for the position of:
 
Head of the ALMA Department of Engineering (Head of ADE)
 
 
Duties and Responsibilities
The Joint ALMA Observatory (JAO) is seeking a senior engineering manager to lead the ALMA Department of Engineering (ADE), which is responsible for leading a large, multidisciplinary engineering team at the Joint ALMA Observatory in Chile consisting of over a hundred staff. The Head of ADE also plays a key role in supporting the scientific mission of ALMA by ensuring engineering systems meet the observatory’s high availability and precision requirements.
The department’s primary mission is to ensure the reliable operation and long-term sustainability of ALMA’s technical infrastructure, including the upkeep, oversight, and improvement of high-technology systems and infrastructure such as antennas, power systems, scientific instrumentation, and site facilities with a strong focus on sustainable operational performance and effective risk management and mitigation.
The position also entails proactive risk management in response to aging systems through implementation of sustainability-driven mitigation strategies in partnership with the ALMA Integrated Engineering Team (IET) to optimize maintenance plans, establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), and continuous assessment of risks.
This role demands strategic leadership to guide the department through the next 5-10 years, a critical transition period for the observatory as a major upgrade, the Wideband Sensitivity Upgrade (WSU), of the complete ALMA signal chain is installed and brought to full operation. This requires strong coordination across departments, particularly with Science Operations and Computing, to maintain operational continuity and to coordinate effective management through the transition to the fully operational WSU system.
The position also requires commitment to effective team leadership and staff management to build a high-performance team in a multi-cultural, multi-national environment at the observatory, and maintaining strong collaborations with ALMA's international partners.
 
Main Responsibilities 
·      Provide strategic leadership to sustain, optimize, and enhance the long-term effectiveness of engineering operations at the JAO, with a primary focus on reliability and sustainability.
·      Lead the Engineering Department through the ALMA Wideband Sensitivity Upgrade (WSU) transition, ensuring effective coordination of legacy and WSU systems and defining future engineering workflows.
·      Build and manage a high-performance team through best practices in people management, including training, certification, professional development, team empowerment and cross-team collaborations. 
·      Oversee departmental resources, including budgeting, staffing, and strategic personnel allocation for projects and operations.
·      Ensure delivery of engineering outcomes, including:
o  Integration and operational implementation of system upgrades;
o  Performance monitoring and characterization of engineering systems;
o  Identification and implementation of operational improvements;
o  Preventive and corrective maintenance of all systems and infrastructure;
o  Development and execution of comprehensive maintenance, risk management, and obsolescence management plans for all observatory systems, including antennas, scientific instrumentation. power systems, facilities, and site utilities.
·      Monitor engineering performance, analyze trends, oversee fault reporting and resolution processes, and manage system configuration and health tracking.
·      Coordinate and monitor array reconfiguration and related antenna transport logistics.
·      Enforce compliance with safety standards and policies and promote a strong safety culture within the ADE.
·      Collaborate with the ALMA Integrated Engineering Team (IET) on obsolescence mitigation, KPI monitoring, and optimization of maintenance strategies.
·      Participate in the JAO Operations Team (JOT) to align operational planning, coordinate parallel operations during the WSU transition, and implementing and maturing the future WSU operations.
·      Contribute to observatory-wide strategic planning as a member of the Core Management Team (CMT).
·      Represent ADE in interactions with ALMA Executive organizations and external partners related to infrastructure, procurement, or engineering development.
·      Contribute to long-term technology strategy by identifying emerging technologies or practices that can improve observatory operations or sustainability.
·      Perform other duties as assigned by the ALMA Deputy Director of Operations.
description.requirements:
Professional Requirements/Qualifications 
Applicants for this position should fulfill the following requirements: 
Minimum requirements (must have):
·      University degree in Engineering or a related discipline.
·      At least 10 years of relevant engineering experience in complex operational environments, ideally involving high-technology systems or scientific infrastructure.
·      Experience leading teams in multicultural, international environments.
·      A minimum of 5 years in leadership/ managerial roles, with demonstrated responsibility for engineering operations, team leadership, and resource planning.
·      Proven experience in sustaining and optimizing engineering systems, including preventive and corrective maintenance, and long-term infrastructure and asset management.
·      Strong communication skills in English (minimum B level).
Desirable Requirements (an asset if present): 
·      Professional engineering certification.
·      Experience working in an observatory or a similar scientific research facility or infrastructure.
·      Experience in international or multi-cultural work environments, managing remote or distributed teams, and working across time zones.
·      Experience in change management.
·      Familiarity with managing within matrix organizations.
·      Familiarity with radio-frequency systems and technologies, ideally for the millimeter/submillimeter wavelength range.
·      Advanced English proficiency (C level) and intermediate proficiency (B level) in Spanish.
Competencies:
·      Demonstrated strategic leadership, with the ability to drive operational transformation and lead organizational transitions.
·      Strong people leadership and management skills, with a focus on staff development, team empowerment, and inclusive leadership.
·      Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities; capable of leading and engaging large, diverse, and multi-cultural teams across departments and locations.
·      Cultural awareness and the ability to adapt leadership and communication styles to a diverse, multinational environment.
·      Proven experience in planning, budgeting, and resource management within complex technical environments.
·      Familiarity with performance frameworks such as OKRs and KPIs to align objectives, track progress, and ensure accountability.
·      Ability to foster collaboration across departments and with internal and external stakeholders.
·      Skilled in risk-management, continuous improvement, and long-term sustainability of engineering operations.
·      Resilience and sound judgment in dynamic or evolving environments, balancing multiple responsibilities effectively while maintaining focus on quality and priorities.
 
Due to travel requirements and work at high altitudes, a successful high-altitude medical check is a necessary condition of employment for this position.
Duty Station / Location of Position 
The position must spend a considerable portion of time in the Operations Support Facility (OSF) at 2900 m and the Array Operations Site (AOS) located on the nearby Llano de Chajnantor at 5000 m altitude, and some portion in the Santiago Central Office (SCO) in Vitacura. Occasional international travel will be required.
 
Starting Date 
As soon as possible.
 
Contract 
Actual contractual terms will be defined by the selected employer (ESO, AUI/NRAO or NAOJ).
 
 
Remuneration 
ALMA International Staff will be recruited as employees of ESO, AUI/NRAO or NAOJ. Each of these employers offer competitive remuneration packages including a competitive salary as well as comprehensive social benefits, and provide financial support in relocating families. Furthermore, if applicable, an expatriation allowance as well as some other allowances will be added.
 
Application process & contracts
ALMA International Staff Members will be engaged to work at the JAO through one of the Executives: ESO, AUI/NRAO, or NAOJ. Candidates should apply through the Recruitment Portal of any ALMA Executive (ESO, AUI/NRAO, NAOJ). Once the selection process is completed, each ALMA Executive will send a contract offer to the successful candidate, who needs to confirm which offer will decide to take.
 
Each application should be written in English and must include a motivational cover letter, and a Curriculum Vitae. The candidate also must send the names and contact details of a minimum of three references, considering at least one from each of a supervisor, a peer, and a direct report.
 
Applicants submitting their application to ESO are invited to apply online at 
https://jobs.eso.org/
Applicants submitting their application to AUI/NRAO are invited to apply online at 
https://careers.nrao.edu
Applicants submitting their application to NAOJ are invited to send their application and reference letters to 
https://forms.office.com/r/9DRfQjb35a
 
Deadline for receipt of applications to be considered is Friday, November 28th, 2025 (12 pm Chile time).
 
For further information please consult (
www.almaobservatory.org
), as well as the ESO (
www.eso.org
), NRAO (
www.nrao.edu
), and/or NAOJ (
www.nao.ac.jp/en/
) Home Pages.
ESO, NRAO, and NAOJ are Equal Opportunity Employers. The post is equally open to suitably qualified female and male applicants.
 
 
ALMA Values
An important element in any successful employment relationship is harmony in values between an organization and its people.
 
The ALMA Values are:
Excellence
Respect and Diversity
Collaboration
Care
 
Applicants to any ALMA role are asked to reflect on their affinity with these values and advised that they may be asked about them if called for an interview.
 
Equal opportunity
ALMA is committed to providing an equal opportunity environment and is actively seeking to promote a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce, irrespective of gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, ethnicity, or religion.

title: Summer Intern 2026- APO (AI & APO Systems Optimization)

description.description:
Overview:
AI & APO Systems Optimization:
 Gain hands-on experience evaluating Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools available in the market and their potential application in APO (archive/Pipeline) Operations. 
Objectives
Gain hands-on experience evaluating Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools available in the market and their potential application in APO (archive/Pipeline Operations) operations.
Explore how AI can support automation in daily health checks, predictive hardware failure analysis, and network traffic optimization.
Learn how to leverage JIRA, CONFLUENCE (Atlassian) ticket data as a source for improving efficiency in solving recurring issues.
Develop practical insights into how AI-driven solutions can reduce operational workload and improve system reliability.
﻿Deliverables
A comparative report of AI tools, highlighting possible applications, benefits, and limitations in APO operations.
A proof-of-concept (PoC) or prototype showcasing at least one AI use case (e.g., predictive failure detection, network optimization, or JIRA-CONFLUENCE-based problem resolution).
A data exploration summary using JIRA tickets to identify patterns and opportunities for automation.
Final presentation with recommendations and lessons learned during the internship.
Deadline for applications:
 Friday, October 24th, 2025, 12 pm Chile time.
description.requirements:
Required / Core Competencies (expected at entry level):
Software Engineer student.
Basic knowledge of programming (i.e.: Python).
Familiarity with databases and data management concepts.
Interest in Artificial Intelligence, data analysis, and IT operations.
Willingness to learn new technologies and tools.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving mindset.
﻿Desirable (can be learned during the internship):
Experience with machine learning or data analysis libraries (e.g., pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow).
Understanding of APO monitoring practices (health checks, hardware monitoring, network traffic).
Familiarity with ticketing systems such as JIRA (Atlassian).
Skills in data visualization or business intelligence tools.
Strong communication and presentation skills.

title: Summer Intern 2026- IMG (Engineer: Electrical, Electronic, Telematic)

description.description:
The ALMA Department of Engineering, Infrastructure Maintenance Group (ADE-IMG) encompasses a wide range of project and infrastructure operation and maintenance activities, including power generation and distribution, HVAC systems, meteorological stations, UPS systems, and more. With approximately 35 staff members involved in operations, IMG's responsibilities include operational support, as well as preventive and corrective maintenance of critical infrastructure.
IMG is offering an internship opportunity for Engineering students in the fields of electricity, electronics, telematics. The selected candidate’s challenge will be to improve and develop some existing processes, related to Maintenance Management: metrics reports, KPI development, planning & programming, work order and maintenance plans management. 
By participating in internal projects and receiving our guidance, you will have the opportunity to gain insights and learn about:
·      Operational & Maintenance Management
·      Maintenance KPIs development and control
·      Engineering Infrastructure support facilities and equipment
·      World Class Scientific & Multicultural working environment 
Responsibilities:
1.   
Improvement and Integration of IMG KPI and Management Monthly report
: Objective is to improve, automate (as far as possible), integrate and consolidate existing process of generate this report.
2.   
Assessment and Improvement of Maintenance Plans yearly revision Process:
 Objective is to review the mentioned process, that involves not only IMG resources, but also ESG’s, in order to deliver a proper and optimized model / process to improve this activity, with the focus in eliminate re-processes, software/platforms errors and ideally, considers to robust the “control” / “verification” part of the continuing improvement cycle for the maintenance plans implementation and development.
Skills
:
·      Excel medium to advanced level knowledge.
·      General knowledge regarding CMMS software.
·      Basic knowledge in Programming (data queries, routines / algorithms generation, data management, in platforms as Python, Java, C++, Et cetera).
·      Knowledge related to concepts regarding Maintenance Engineering would be an asset (Reliability, RCM, TPM, TQM, Kaizen, 6S, Lean Management, TPM, among others)
 
Deliverables
:
·      A fully operating platform, website and/or archive, that allows to generate in a regular monthly basis the optimized “IMG’s KPI and Management Report”, as automated as possible. As challenge, would be an improvement to develop as a replacement or complement some kind of Dashboard with the same / additional information.
·      A document containing the basis to optimize the IMG Maintenance Plans revision, development and control, that must include, at least: Definitions, Scope, responsibilities and corresponding process(es) diagrams for:
o Improve the quality of information at CMMS platform for: Equipment, Resources, Jobs and Job-guidelines.
o Consistently includes a continuous improvement cycle, with special attention to the verification of the compliance of plans.
o  Interactions between systems, equipment and platforms involved in the “IMG Maintenance Process”. 
General Conditions:
·      Internship duration: 8 weeks, with on-site shifts following an 8x6 schedule.
·      Access to necessary data and software resources will be provided.
·      The internship offers a monthly allowance to partially cover expenses.
Application Process:
 Candidates must submit the following documents:
1.   Motivation letter indicating reasons for applying and areas of interest.
2.   Updated resume (in Spanish or English), detailing technical skills and experience.
3.   University transcript with approved subjects and grades.
4.   Contact information of at least one professional/educational reference.
Deadline for applications:
 Friday, October 24th, 12 pm Chile time.
Direct Supervisor: 
C.A

·      Build good collaborative working relationships with people from different cultural backgrounds and disciplines.
·      Systems Engineering concepts knowledge and processes-based focus mindset will be an asset.

title: Summer Intern 2026- IMG (estudios en Técnico Mecánico)

description.description:
Resumen:
El Grupo de Mantenimiento de Infraestructura (IMG) del Departamento de Ingeniería de ALMA abarca una amplia gama de actividades de operación y mantenimiento de proyectos e infraestructura, incluyendo generación y distribución de energía, sistemas de climatización, estaciones meteorológicas, sistemas UPS, entre otros. Con aproximadamente 35 miembros del personal involucrados en las operaciones, las responsabilidades de IMG incluyen soporte operativo, así como el mantenimiento preventivo y correctivo de la infraestructura crítica.
IMG ofrece una oportunidad de pasantía para estudiantes o egresados ​​de Ingeniería Mecánica. El desafío para los candidatos seleccionados será formar parte activa de un equipo de alto rendimiento en un entorno científico de clase mundial, bajo la supervisión de personal técnico experimentado.
Participando en las actividades de mantenimiento regulares y mayores, y recibiendo nuestra orientación, tendrá la oportunidad de adquirir conocimientos y experiencia en:
·      Operación y mantenimiento de equipos mecánicos.
·      Mantenimiento de equipos críticos de climatización.
·      Operación de turbinas generadoras de energía y generadores diésel.
·      Equipos del taller de IMG, que incluye máquinas herramienta, máquinas CNC, fresadoras y tornos.
·      Instalaciones y equipos de apoyo a la infraestructura de ingeniería.
Responsabilidades:
·      Apoyar al personal técnico de IMG en tareas de mantenimiento programado y reparaciones correctivas de equipos mecánicos bajo su responsabilidad.
·      Participar activamente en actividades de capacitación y experiencias prácticas según sea necesario.
·      Participar en la evaluación, diagnóstico y reparación de fallas de nivel simple a moderado en sistemas y componentes mecánicos.
·      Realizar las tareas asignadas con responsabilidad y proactividad. Apoyar actividades de otras especialidades dentro de sus capacidades, cumpliendo con los requisitos de seguridad y técnicos.
Habilidades
:
•    Conocimientos técnicos y teóricos de mecánica, de acuerdo con sus estudios.
•    Capacidad para leer e interpretar planos técnicos y conocimientos técnicos sólidos.
•    Habilidad en uso de herramientas manuales mecánicas, como llaves, destornilladores, pinzas, niveles, herramientas de medición, herramientas eléctricas, etc.
•    Se valorará el conocimiento general de sistemas y equipos de generación de energía.
•    La capacidad para resolver problemas y el pensamiento analítico también se valorarán.
 
Entregables
:
·      Reportes de turno, para ser utilizado como “cambio de turno” con su contraturno, colega de práctica y supervisores IMG.
·      Un informe final de práctica que contenga al menos, los siguientes puntos:
o Introducción y motivación.
o Objectivos y metas.
o Desarrollo de actividades y desempeño.
o Lecciones aprendidas.
o Conclusiones.
Condiciones Generales:
·      Duración de la práctica: 8 semanas, con turnos presenciales de 8x6.
·      Se proporcionarán las herramientas y el equipo de protección personal necesarios.
·      La práctica incluye una compensación mensual para cubrir gastos.
Proceso de Postulación:
 Los candidatos deben presentar los siguientes documentos:
1.   Carta de Presentación, indicando los motivos de la postulación y las áreas de interés.
2.   Curriculum Vitae actualizado, detallando habilidades técnicas y experiencia.
3.   Certificado de estudios de la Institución de Educación Superior, con asignaturas aprobadas y calificaciones.
4.   Información de contacto de al menos una referencia profesional/académica.
Fecha límite de postulaciones:
 Viernes 24 de octubre, 12 pm
Supervisores Directos: 
C.A. / C.E.
description.requirements:
Requerimientos:
·      Graduado/a reciente de una institución de educación superior chilena en la carrera de Técnico Mecánico o equivalente, con un mínimo de cuatro semestres cursados ​​con éxito.
·      Aptitud física para trabajar en alta montaña (las instalaciones se encuentran entre los 2.900 y 5.000 metros sobre el nivel del mar).
·      Nivel de inglés: A2, capacidad para leer y comprender manuales, instrucciones y documentación técnica en inglés.
·      Conocimientos básicos de informática: manejo de hojas de cálculo, procesadores de texto, programas de planificación y herramientas web.
Competencias:
·      Capacidad para establecer y mantener relaciones de trabajo efectivas con todo el personal de la organización, considerando que ALMA tiene un entorno multinacional y multicultural.
·      Espíritu de equipo, disposición para aprender y colaborar, autonomía, iniciativa, flexibilidad, proactividad y responsabilidad.
·      Conocimiento y compromiso con las normas de Seguridad, Salud Ocupacional y Medio Ambiente (HSEC) y los conceptos de gestión de riesgos.

description.description:

title: Summer Intern 2026- IMG (Ingeniería Industrial o Mecánica)

description.description:
Práctica de Verano 2026, oportunidad para estudiantes de ingeniería industrial, ingeniería mecánica o a fines.
El departamento de Infrastructure Maintenance Group (IMG) es el encargado de mantener y operar parte de los equipos principales de la infraestructurade ALMA. Entre estos sistemas se destaca la generación eléctrica del observatorio, HVAC y red contra incendios, incluyendo todos sus componentes. El departamento está compuesto por especialistas del área mecánica, eléctrica e instrumentación, junto a técnicos que realizan las tareas diarias que permiten que la operación del observatorio no se detenga.
 
Esta práctica de verano está orientada a trabajar junto al especialista de la disciplina mecánica. Tendrás la oportunidad de: 
·          Conocer el observatorio ALMA, su misión y visión.
·          Relacionarte con equipos mecánicos, su operación y mantención.
·          Colaborar con los especialistas del área en actividades reales.
 
Responsabilidades:
·          Generar un sistema para el control de pago de contratos, que actualmente son controlados por el y la especialista de la disciplina mecánica.
·          Estimar costos del área mecánica parametrizada con el sistema interno de compras.
·          Proyecto de cambio de partes y/o equipos por obsolescencia.
 
Descripción de los trabajos a realizar:
·      Elaboración de un documento en Smartsheet que facilite el seguimiento de los estados de pago de los contratos más importantes gestionados por el área mecánica del departamento IMG con proveedores externos. Se busca estandarizar el control de los estados de pago, de manera que el proceso sea aplicable a futuros proyectos o contratos.
·      Las compras se crean en un sistema interno y en línea, mediante la creación de una solicitud. Se necesita parametrizar las que estén relacionadas con el área mecánica, de forma que se pueda hacer un seguimiento de los gastos estimados para el año y proyectar gastos anuales.
·      La gestión de la obsolescencia es fundamental para el correcto funcionamiento del observatorio. Para controlarla, se ha desarrollado una matriz que define la criticidad de los equipos más relevantes para la operación. Es necesario consultar con los proveedores la viabilidad de implementar las estrategias definidas para mitigar los riesgos asociados.
Condiciones Generales:
·      Duración de la práctica: 8 semanas, con modalidad presencial en sistemas de turnos 8x6
·      Se proporcionará acceso a los datos y recursos de software necesarios.
·      La práctica ofrece una asignación mensual para cubrir parcialmente los gastos.
 
Proceso de Postulación: 
Los candidatos deben enviar los siguientes documentos:
·      Carta de motivación indicando los motivos para postular y áreas de interés.
·      Currículum actualizado (en español o inglés) detallando habilidades técnicas y experiencia.
·      Certificado de estudios con asignaturas aprobadas y calificaciones.
·      Información de contacto de al menos una referencia profesional.
Fecha límite de postulaciones: 
Viernes 24 de octubre 2025, 12 pm.
Supervisor Directo: 
C.SM.

description.description:
Resumen:
El Departamento de Ingeniería de ALMA, Grupo de Mantenimiento de Infraestructura (ADE-IMG) ofrece una oportunidad de práctica técnica para estudiantes en los campos de Ciencias de la Computación, desarrollo de software, control, instrumentación o disciplinas afines.
A través de la participación en este proyecto, el practicante obtendrá experiencia práctica en:
·      Acerca de la misión de ALMA y el rol y responsabilidades de IMG en su implementación.
·      Cómo una asociación científica internacional opera en la práctica, en particular los flujos de trabajo, procesos y procedimientos internos de IMG.
·      Las mejores prácticas aplicadas en ALMA para el desarrollo de proyectos de automatización que contribuyen directamente a la misión global del Observatorio.
Responsabilidades:
1.  
Colaborar en la implementación y puesta en marcha de sistemas automáticos: 
Participar activamente en la planificación, instalación y programación de sistemas automáticos utilizando PLCs, así como también en la integración de instrumentos y sensores para monitoreo y control en tiempo real.
 
2.  
Supervisar y optimizar sistemas de instrumentación: 
Asegurar la correcta instalación, calibración y operación de equipos de medida y control, tales como sensores de temperatura, presión y flujo, entre otros, asegurando la eficiencia y precisión de los procesos automáticos.
 
3.  
Integración de sistemas de detección de incendio y control de accesos: 
Desarrollar y configurar soluciones de seguridad que incluyan los sistemas de detección de incendios, monitoreo de humo y gases y control de acceso, integrando de manera efectiva todos ellos en un solo sistema automático global.
4.  
Evaluar y seleccionar tecnologías viables:
 Desarrollar un análisis exhaustivo de las diferentes opciones tecnológicas disponibles, considerando factores como costo, eficiencia, escalabilidad y compatibilidad con los sistemas existentes para asegurar una implementación práctica y exitosa.
5.  
Facilitar interoperabilidad entre sistemas: 
Promover la integración de diferentes plataformas y tecnologías para trabajar juntas de manera eficiente, asegurando una comunicación fluida entre sistemas de automatización, seguridad y control.
Habilidades:
·      
Conocimiento de algoritmos de control:
 capacidad de diseñar, implementar y optimizar algoritmos de control para asegurar una operación eficiente y estable en sistemas automáticos.
·      
Lenguajes de programación:
 capacidad de programación en lenguajes tales como 
Ladder Logic, scripting languaje
 y otros lenguajes y ambientes de programación de PLCs utilizados para sistemas de automatización y control.
·      
Identificación de sensores: 
capacidad de identificar y trabajar con varios tipos de sensores, incluyendo termistores NTC, lazos de corriente de 4-20[mA], sensores de tensión 0-10[V], asegurando una apropiada selección e integración en sistemas de control.
·      
Electrónica Digital y Análoga:
 Sólida comprensión de electrónica análoga y digital, incluyendo la capacidad de diseñar, resolver problemas y reparar circuitos para aplicaciones de automatización y control industrial.
Entregables:
·      
Informe Final: 
 Documento completo que debe detallar los hallazgos, metodologías y resultados del estudio, incluyendo el análisis técnico, implementación del sistema y la evaluación de las tecnologías seleccionadas. El informe debe también incluir recomendaciones para mejoras futuras y optimizaciones.
·      
Presentación con las conclusiones del estudio: 
Una presentación ejecutiva que destaque los hallazgos clave y las conclusiones del estudio, incluyendo el proceso de evaluación y selección de soluciones e impacto global. Esta debe ser presentada a todos los interesados y debe entregar información clara que facilite la toma de decisiones.
Condiciones Generales:
·      Duración: 8 semanas, con modalidad presencial en sistemas de turnos 8x6
·      Se proporcionará acceso a los datos y recursos de software necesarios.
·      La práctica ofrece una asignación mensual para cubrir parcialmente los gastos.
Proceso de Postulación:
 Los candidatos deben enviar los siguientes documentos:
Carta de motivación indicando los motivos para postular y áreas de interés.
Currículum actualizado (en español o inglés) detallando habilidades técnicas y experiencia.
Certificado de estudios con asignaturas aprobadas y calificaciones.
Información de contacto de al menos una referencia profesional.

Viernes 24 de octubre 2025, 12 pm.
Supervisor Directo: 
C.R.

description.description:
Tittle:
 Alarm system for the Monitoring Data System (MDS) and the supporting services related to MDS
Purpose:
Study alternatives and implement a diverse alarm system for the MDS on its Kubernetes environment using Terraform for its deployment (or alternatively, use the Rancher user interface), as well as study alternatives and implement an alarm system for the ActiveMQ and Monitoring-Consumer services (supporting services of the MDS) that live in virtual machines and are deployed using Docker Compose. Finally, study possible improvements for the service of the MDS Data Gap Detector. Every specific objective must be thoroughly documented.
Description:
The Monitoring Data System (MDS) is a complex system that is responsible for storing and making available to the users the ALMA device's monitoring data. This system is delicate and there is currently a requirement for the Software Team of monitoring the different aspects of this system, including: Status of the Kubernetes cluster and the worker nodes that compose it, and status of the pods that are deployed in the Kubernetes (being the most important pods the ones that are related to the Database, implemented in Cassandra), for what is requested to implement alarms. Also, MDS has some supporting services, to be specific: Monitoring- Consumer, responsible for formatting the monitoring data so it can be inserted into the Cassandra database, and ActiveMQ, which is the queue service that queues the formatted monitoring data; these services are also required to be monitored and to send alarms when the servers go down or when the resources usage is too high, such as RAM and disk space. Finally, there is a service called Data Gap Detector, that monitors if the monitoring data queried on the MDS's API presents any data gap, and reports when this occurs; this application may have some improvements, and it is necessary to evaluate what improvements it could have.
Objectives:
General Objective:
Implement a variety of alarms to be deployed in the different environments related to the MDS. These alarms will allow the maintainers of those systems to be alerted of possible problems with their resources' usage and the status of the services.
Specific Objectives:
Implement and thoroughly document the alarm system for the MDS, to live in its Kubernetes environment, using the infrastructure-as-code tool Terraform. Investigate and thoroughly document different alternatives for implementing an alarm system for the MDS's supporting applications, which live in virtual machines and are implemented using Docker containers. Implement and thoroughly document an alarm system that monitors the status of the supporting applications of the MDS. Study possible improvements for the service of the Data Gap Detector, related to the MDS system.
Deliverables:
The expected deliverables are:
Terraform scripts with the implementation of a variety of alarms for the MDS system in its testing environment, as well as for its "Failover" environment. Documentation of the investigation of different alternatives for the implementation of an alarm system for the supporting applications of the MDS. Implementation and documentation of the alarm system that monitors the status of the supporting applications of the MDS. Documentation of possible improvements for the Data Gap Detector service.
﻿Deadline for applications: 
Friday, October 24th, 2025 at 12 pm Chile time.

title: Summer Intern 2026- Software (Development of Automated Generation)

description.description:
Tittle:
Development of Automated Generation of deployment.yaml and compose.yaml files for AES Framework.
Purpose:
To automate the generation of deployment.yaml and compose.yaml files for AES Offline services from a unified configuration dictionary, reduce information redundancy, and prepare the framework for deploying into a Kubernetes cluster.
Description:
Currently, each AES Offline service maintains its own individual deployment configuration under directory services/<app name>/deploy/. It uses compose files (compose.yml) for instructing docker swarm on the deployment configuration. The student will develop an Ansible role that automatically generates Kubernetes deployment.yaml files and Docker Swarm compatible compose.yml files from a single configuration file that contains a single dictionary. This dictionary will contain all necessary information for deployment configuration, many of which are already declared in each application's existing deploy/compose.yml files. The solution will significantly reduce the number of configuration files that need to be maintained if Kubernetes deployment gets supported by AES Framework. While ensuring that all applications remain aligned with consistent deployment standards.
In essence, this implementation will facilitate the transition from Docker Swarm to Kubernetes by providing a unified source of configuration that can generate appropriate files for either orchestration platform. The automated generation approach will also extend to internal and external proxy configurations, which will be defined within the same application configuration dictionary and used to generate the corresponding proxy configuration files. This approach will improve maintainability, reduce configuration drift between environments, and provide a solid foundation for managing the complex deployment requirements of ALMA's scientific computing infrastructure.
Objectives:
General Objective:
Develop Ansible role tasks within the AES Framework to automatically generate deployment and compose files for Offline services from a unified configuration dictionary, supporting both Kubernetes and Docker Swarm deployments while integrating external and internal proxy configurations.
Specific Objectives:
Study the AES Framework used for deploying ALMA OFFLINE Services.
Analyze existing deploy/compose.yml files across AES Offline applications to identify common configuration patterns and parameters.
Design a comprehensive configuration dictionary structure that consolidates deployment parameters from existing files.
Create Ansible tasks within a dedicated role to generate Kubernetes deployment files from the unified dictionary.
Create Ansible tasks within the same role to generate Docker Compose files from the unified dictionary.
Implement internal proxy configuration generation as part of the automated deployment file creation process.
Deliverables:
The expected deliverables are:
Git repository/branch (docker repo) with the necessary changes to the configuration that we already have.
Configuration dictionary schema documentation defining the structure and required parameters for application configurations.
Template files for generating both Kubernetes deployment files and Docker Compose files from the unified dictionary.
Implementation guide documenting how to use the new role.
Deadline for applications:
 Friday, October 24th, 2025, 12 pm Chile time.
description.requirements:
Required:
Basic knowledge of Linux operating systems and command line.
Understanding of containerization concepts (e.g., Docker).
Ability to read and write technical documentation in English.
Desirable:
Previous experience with Docker Swarm, Kubernetes, or other container orchestration tools.
Knowledge of Ansible or other configuration/infrastructure management tools.
Interest in learning about infrastructure for large-scale scientific systems (e.g., ALMA).

title: Summer Intern 2026- Software (Development of Network services API)

description.description:
Tittle: 
Development of Network services API for resource movement/location tracking.
Purpose:
﻿
To provide a centralized/standard way to query OSF resource locations and perform resource movements via an API; to be used by scripts/internal webs. Desirable for WSU tasks and mitigating the security risks of having network switches exposed.
Description:
The Atacama Large Millimeter/Submillimeter Array (ALMA) is one of the most advanced astronomical observatories in the world. It is located in the Atacama Desert of northern Chile. Its scientific mission depends on highly complex software systems that coordinate operations, manage large-scale data processing, and continuously deliver reliable services to support astronomical research. One of the many tasks that is performed at Software Support Operations at ALMA Department of Computing, consists in virtually moving/tracking different sorts of resources (such as antennas, computers, between other kinds of hardware devices) across distinct environments/locations in OSF (Operations Support Facility) for different scenarios, such as Science Operations, Engineering Maintenance, Software Testing, etc. Many of those operations are done using network switches configuration on-the-fly, via different scripts and platforms across the system (moveSteComponents, moveAntennas, VRFS, among others). In the following periods, resource movement activity will be highly increased due to an ongoing upgrade in the observatory (Wide-sensitivity upgrade); then having a reliable and secure tool for tracking the location and making movements of different resources is highly desirable for next periods.
This internship will focus on studying, planning, and implementing an API capable of managing the resource location and movement in a unified way, which existing and future scripts and internal platforms will use. The student will study and get to know the observatory infrastructure, then will help to create a potential mechanism for locating resources across ALMA infrastructure/network and moving these between different internal environments. Through this experience, the student will gain practical experience implementing solutions for state-of-the-art infrastructure, working with multi-disciplinary teams, and deepening knowledge in operations, support, and networking in a distributed system. The internship will also provide opportunities to collaborate with experienced engineers, understand the challenges of maintaining critical systems, and develop solutions that contribute directly to the robustness of the software processes in ALMA.
Objectives:
General objective
Study, design, and develop an API capable of moving and tracking various resources across environments at ALMA Operations Support Facility.
Specific objectives
Study ALMA ONLINE Infrastructure to learn core concepts like resource types, locations, and network infrastructure.
Investigate and test a potential way to get and move the location of different resources across ALMA using existing infrastructure.
Using the proposed solutions, design and develop an API that could centrally handle resource movements and location querying.
Provide proper documentation for maintenance and troubleshooting.
Deliverables:
The expected deliverables are:
Documents explaining a potential way to obtaining resource locations performing resource movements.
Git repository with an implementation of the API.
Documentation of the implemented API.
﻿
Deadline for applications: 
Friday, October 24th, 12 pm Chile time
Working location: 
Santiago Central Office, or Operations Support Facility (OSF- Close to San Pedro de Atacama) in a 8X6 shift.
